turns.context:
Parent: Hey kiddo, want to play a game of chess with me?
Child: Sure! How do you play?
turns.ground_truth: Well, each player has 16 pieces and the objective is to put the opponent's king in checkmate. Do you want me to teach you the rules?

turns.context:
Child: Sure! How do you play?
Parent: Well, each player has 16 pieces and the objective is to put the opponent's king in checkmate. Do you want me to teach you the rules?
Child: Yeah, please show me.
turns.ground_truth: Okay, so these are the pawns. They can move forward one or two spaces on their first move and then one space after that. And this is the rook, it can move in straight lines horizontally or vertically.

turns.context:
Child: Yeah, please show me.
Parent: Okay, so these are the pawns. They can move forward one or two spaces on their first move and then one space after that. And this is the rook, it can move in straight lines horizontally or vertically.
Child: Oh, I see.
turns.ground_truth: And this is the knight. It moves in L-shaped formations. And this is the bishop, it moves diagonally.

turns.context:
Child: Oh, I see.
Parent: And this is the knight. It moves in L-shaped formations. And this is the bishop, it moves diagonally.
Child: Got it.
turns.ground_truth: Finally, we have the queen. It can move in any direction: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. And this is the king, it can only move one square in any direction.
